title: flowstate -- Structure
text: Flow Cytometry Standard files read parsed flowstate (S3 object). flowstate primarily comprised following parsed (named list) elements – data.table::data.table(): Included package – purpose example(s) – (subsampled) .fcs files acquired Cytek Aurora (5L) using SpectroFlo software. Read/parse flowstate using flowstate::read.flowstate().
code: ##paths to example .fcs files fcs.files <- system.file("extdata", package = "flowstate") |>    list.files(full.names = T) |>   grep(pattern = "BLOCK.*.fcs",value = T) fcs.files |> basename() |> print() #> [1] "COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_1.fcs" "COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_2.fcs" #> [3] "COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_3.fcs"  ##read them in and concatenate; a flowstate object fs <- flowstate::read.flowstate(   fcs.file.paths = fcs.files,   colnames.type = "S_N",   concatenate = TRUE ) #> COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_1.fcs --> flowstate #> COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_2.fcs --> flowstate #> COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_3.fcs --> flowstate #> Concatenating 'flowstate.ojects'...  ##S3 object of class "flowstate" class(fs) #> [1] "flowstate" ##flowstate structure names(fs) #> [1] "data"       "parameters" "keywords"   "spill"

title: flowstate -- Structure
text: Data can accessed name via: fs$data fs[['data']]. [['data']] contains events rows scatter, time, fluorescent measurements columns. design, transformation applied linear measurement values reading. addition, unique sample identifier (factored) added workflow purposes.

title: flowstate -- Structure
text: Keywords can accessed name via: fs$keywords fs[['keywords']]. [['keywords']] contains instrument/sample-specific metadata. information contained leveraged number different actions, : platform/cytometer identification; extracting adding unique identifiers [['data']]; adding/constructing new keywords purpose analysis/workflow; QC/diagnostics. Following best practices laid Flow Cytometry Standard, series keywords added mark flowstate object(s) modified – longer source data. inclusion keywords ('$LAST_MODIFIED', '$LAST_MODIFIER', '$ORIGINALITY') ensures transparency indication explicitly modified.

title: flowstate -- Structure
text: Spill can accessed name via: fs$spill fs[['spill']]. [['spill']] contains instrument/sample-specific spill() matrix – encoded. can modified correction values applied [['data']] (try ) fix unmixing/compensation errors. Unless explicitly modified user, default matrix contain correction values. N.B.: software manufacturers – least SpectroFlo – write small value (1E-6) first matrix pair; think overcome bug FlowJo handles matrix…

title: Prepare Analysis Project/Directories
code: ##create an analysis project with a meaningful name -- here the name of the study path.project <- file.path(tempdir(),"COVAIL") usethis::create_project(   path = path.project,   open = FALSE ) |> suppressMessages() ##within the project: create a directory structure for organizing analysis/workflow sapply(paste0("data_",c('source','modified','results','meta','temp')),function(.dir){     .dir <- file.path(path.project,.dir)     if(!dir.exists(.dir)) dir.create(.dir) }) |> invisible() ##directory structure of project list.dirs(path.project) #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp4uDfJg/COVAIL"               #> [2] "/tmp/Rtmp4uDfJg/COVAIL/data_meta"     #> [3] "/tmp/Rtmp4uDfJg/COVAIL/data_modified" #> [4] "/tmp/Rtmp4uDfJg/COVAIL/data_results"  #> [5] "/tmp/Rtmp4uDfJg/COVAIL/data_source"   #> [6] "/tmp/Rtmp4uDfJg/COVAIL/data_temp"     #> [7] "/tmp/Rtmp4uDfJg/COVAIL/R"

title: Prepare Analysis Project/Directories
code: temp <- tempfile(tmpdir = file.path(path.project,"data_temp"),fileext = ".zip") zip.link <- "https://figshare.com/ndownloader/articles/30380776?private_link=38afd2ef2906779e8605" curl::curl_download(url = zip.link, destfile = temp) ##files contained in the .zip utils::unzip(temp,list = TRUE) |> head() ##unzip all to "./data_source" utils::unzip(temp,files=NULL,exdir = file.path(path.project,"data_source")) ##source files (raw) in "./data_source" files.source <- list.files(file.path(path.project,"data_source"),full.names=T,recursive = T) print(sub("^.*/COVAIL","",files.source)) |> head() ##verify integrity using hashes hash.historic <- "315cb3f534f175fa070df488a49f525a" hash.source <- sapply(files.source,tools::md5sum) |> as.vector() |> digest::digest() hash.historic == hash.source if(hash.historic == hash.source){   unlink(temp) }

text: flowstate provides system processing, analyzing, visualizing Flow Cytometry Standard (FCS) data. primary features flowstate: Read parse .fcs files flowstate objects (S3) Perform spectral unmixing (Full Spectrum Cytometry/Spectral Cytometry) Perform spillover compensation/correction Transform expression values (MFI/ion counts) Visualize primary data Write FCS version 3.1 compliant files

title: Flow Cytometry Standard (FCS) Processing, Analysis, and Visualization
text: can install development version flowstate GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("nlaniewski/flowstate")

title: Flow Cytometry Standard (FCS) Processing, Analysis, and Visualization
text: Paths previously acquired .fcs files: Read/concatenate: Transform: Visualize:
code: fcs.file.paths <- system.file("extdata", package = "flowstate") |>   list.files(full.names = TRUE, pattern = "BLOCK.*.fcs") fs <- flowstate::read.flowstate(fcs.file.paths,colnames.type = "S",concatenate = TRUE) #> COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_1.fcs --> flowstate #> COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_2.fcs --> flowstate #> COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_BLOCK1_3.fcs --> flowstate #> Concatenating 'flowstate.ojects'... flowstate::flowstate.transform(fs,transform.type = 'asinh',cofactor = 5000) #> flowstate.object --> transforming... plot(fs,CD3,Viability) + ggplot2::guides(fill = 'none') + ggplot2::facet_wrap(~sample.id) ##needs compensation correction plot(fs,CD4,CD8) + ggplot2::guides(fill = 'none') ##update [['spill']] with a correction value flowstate::spillover.update.value(fs,CD8,CD4,0.03) ##apply spillover correction flowstate::spillover.apply(fs) #> flowstate.object --> transforming... ##compensated data plot(fs,CD4,CD8) + ggplot2::guides(fill = 'none')

title: Add keyword values to flowstate[['data']] — add.keywords.to.data

title: Transform flowstate[['data']] — flowstate.transform
text: flowstate.object flowstate object returned read.flowstate. .j Character vector – default NULL; /parameters keyword-value pair TYPE/Raw|Unmixed_Fluorescence transformed [['data']].  character vector: specific columns [['data']] transformed. transform.type Character string – default asinh; quoted function used transform .j [['data']]. cofactor Numeric – default 5000; transform.type = asinh (default), cofactor used modify transformation.

title: Transform flowstate[['data']] — flowstate.transform
text: UPDATES REFERENCE: flowstate[['data']]; transformed values flowstate[['parameters']]; adds two columns ('transform' 'cofactor') Invisibly returns flowstate.object.

The package "hexbin" is required for `stat_bin_hex()`.  fs$data[,sapply(.SD,mean),.SDcols = c('CD3','CD8')] #>       CD3       CD8  #> 1.8223658 0.9800536   #inverse transformation flowstate.transform.inverse(fs)  #updated parameters; transform and cofactor set to NA fs$parameters[S %in% c('CD3','CD8')] #>       par      B DISPLAY      E        N       R      S                 TYPE #>    <char> <char>  <char> <char>   <char>  <char> <char>               <char> #> 1:   $P16     32     LOG    0,0 BUV805-A 4194304    CD8 Unmixed_Fluorescence #> 2:   $P30     32     LOG    0,0  RB744-A 4194304    CD3 Unmixed_Fluorescence #>         V                           PROJ N.alias S.alias  S_N.alias transform #>    <char>                         <fctr>  <char>  <char>     <char>    <char> #> 1:   1087 COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_2025-02-27  BUV805     CD8 CD8_BUV805      <NA> #> 2:    253 COVAIL_002_CYTOKINE_2025-02-27   RB744     CD3  CD3_RB744      <NA> #>    cofactor #>       <num> #> 1:       NA #> 2:       NA  #plot and mean values of linear columns plot(fs,CD3,CD8) + ggplot2::guides(fill = 'none') #> Warning: Computation failed in `stat_binhex()`. #> Caused by error in `compute_group()`: #> ! The package "hexbin" is required for `stat_bin_hex()`.  res2.linear <- fs$data[,sapply(.SD,mean),.SDcols = c('CD3','CD8')] print(res2.linear) #>      CD3      CD8  #> 25878.14 21843.70   #linear --> transformed --> inverse --> linear res1.linear == res2.linear #>  CD3  CD8  #> TRUE TRUE

what: flowstate: read, parse, and store .fcs data — read.flowstate
title: flowstate: read, parse, and store .fcs data — read.flowstate
text: Flow Cytometry Standard files read, parsed stored objects (S3) class 'flowstate'. individual segments (TEXT DATA) FCS file parsed stored follows: [['data']] – data.table containing raw/linear measurement values (scatter, MFI, Time, etc.). [['parameters']] – data.table containing instrument-specific parameters ('$PnN','$PnS', etc.). [['keywords']] – data.table containing instrument/sample-specific keyword-value pairs (metadata). [['spill']] – data.table containing (present) spillover values.

title: flowstate: read, parse, and store .fcs data — read.flowstate
code: read.flowstate(   fcs.file.paths,   colnames.type = c("S_N", "S", "N"),   S.func = NULL,   sample.id = NULL,   concatenate = FALSE )

title: flowstate: read, parse, and store .fcs data — read.flowstate
text: fcs.file.paths Character string; path(s) returned list.files(...,full.names=T,pattern=".fcs"). colnames.type Character string; one : "S_N" – [['data']] columns named combining $PS (stain) $PN (name), separated underscore. "S" – [['data']] columns named using respective $PS (stain) keyword value. "N" – [['data']] columns named using respective $PN (name) keyword value. S.func function – default NULL; function supplied, used modify/split "S"; e.g. function(j){strsplit(j," ")[[1]][1]} applied "S" return first split element ("CD4 PE" –> "CD4"). sample.id Keyword name – default NULL; based cytometer platform, keyword name sample.id automatically set respective keyword values added [['data']] factored sample identifier. One : Aurora (Cytek) – sample.id = 'TUBENAME' ID7000 (Sony)  – sample.id = '$CELLS' Unspecified    – sample.id = '$FIL' concatenate Logical – default FALSE; TRUE, list flowstate objects combined single flowstate object.

title: flowstate: read, parse, and store .fcs data — read.flowstate
text: single file: object class flowstate; multiple files: named list flowstate objects; concatenated files: object class flowstate

title: flowstate: read, parse, and store .fcs data — read.flowstate
text: Access individual named list elements follows (assuming flowstate object named fs): fs$data fs[['data']] fs$parameters fs[['parameters']] fs$keywords fs[['keywords']] fs$spill fs[['spill']] flowstate functions operate entire object (fs) access individual slots needed.

title: flowstate: read, parse, and store .fcs data — read.flowstate

R package version 1.17.99, https://r-datatable.com.

title: A flowstate containing spectrally-associated bead/cellular events. — reference.group.spectral.events
text: function entirely dependent – now – following: Spectroflo software raw reference controls  – tested using SpectroFlo 3.3.0. Spectroflo software naming convention: Directory – './Raw/Reference Group/...' File names – 'MARKER FLUOR (Beads|Cells).fcs' (literal space characters separating) Quality reference controls – well resolved, dominant scatter populations

title: A flowstate containing spectrally-associated bead/cellular events. — reference.group.spectral.events
code: reference.group.spectral.events(   raw.reference.group,   transform = FALSE,   quantiles = NULL,   population.markers = NULL,   top.N.percent = 1,   height.cut.scatter = 0.5,   n.detector.events = 200,   detector.override = NULL,   n.spectral.events = 200,   n.spectral.events.unstained = 1000,   n.spectral.events.override = NULL,   plot = FALSE,   plot.dir = "$PROJ",   verbose = FALSE )

title: A flowstate containing spectrally-associated bead/cellular events. — reference.group.spectral.events
text: raw.reference.group file.path – one : reference group directory containing raw single-color/universal negative control .fcs files; processed. vector files within directory; used process subset controls. transform Logical – default FALSE; TRUE, parameters (detectors) keyword-value pair  TYPE/Raw_Fluorescence transformed using asinh(x/5000). quantiles Named list – default NULL; defined, list must conform following: list('scatter' = probs,'fluor' = probs), probs defines numeric vector length 2. e.g., list('scatter' = c(0,0.99),'fluor' = c(0,0.999)); defined, 'scatter' (forward side) 'fluor' (fluorescence) associated events excluded processing based respective probs. population.markers Named character vector – default NULL; population.markers must defined function successful (cellular controls). named character vector take following form: c(population.name1 = 'sample.name1',population.name2 = 'sample.name2',...), population.name(s) lineage cell types 'sample.name(s)' lineage markers used stain respective cell types. e.g., c(lymphocytes = 'CD3 BV510 (Cells)', monocytes = 'CD14 SB550 (Cells)'. defined population.markers used 'cellular anchors': top expressing events (peak detector) named sample used 'anchor' scatter distributions proper assignment named population. top.N.percent Numeric – default 1; defines number top expressing events (peak detector) used conjunction population.markers detecting assigning named populations. height.cut.scatter Numeric – default 0.5; defines value scatter peak heights cut fine tuning selected populations (defined population.markers). n.detector.events Numeric – default 100; number maximally expressing events (sorted vector) used auto-detect reference control-specific peak detectors. detector.override Named character vector – default NULL; defined, supplied detector name (value) override auto-detected peak detector reference control-specific (name) basis. See example. n.spectral.events Numeric – default 250; number maximally expressing events (sorted vector) used define 'spectral events'. n.spectral.events.unstained Numeric – default 1000; number maximally expressing events (sorted vector) used define '(universal) negative' events. n.spectral.events.override Named numeric vector – default NULL; defined, supplied numeric (value) override n.spectral.events sample-specific (name) basis. See example. plot Logical – default FALSE; plots diagnostic/QC output evaluating function performance. plot.dir Character vector – default '$PROJ'; value associated keyword '$PROJ' (experiment name) used construct plot output directory. verbose Logical – default FALSE; print function-associated messages console.

title: A flowstate containing spectrally-associated bead/cellular events. — reference.group.spectral.events
text: flowstate containing spectrally-associated bead/cellular events.

title: A flowstate containing spectrally-associated bead/cellular events. — reference.group.spectral.events
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ##single-color reference controls raw.ref.files <- system.file("extdata", package = "flowstate") |> list.files(full.names = TRUE, pattern = "Beads")  ##simulate a SpectroFlo directory structure raw.ref.dir <- file.path(tempdir(),"Raw","Reference Group") if(!dir.exists(raw.ref.dir)) dir.create(raw.ref.dir,recursive = TRUE) file.copy(   from = raw.ref.files,   to = file.path(raw.ref.dir,basename(raw.ref.files)) ) |> invisible()  ##generate spectral events ref <- reference.group.spectral.events(   raw.reference.group.directory = raw.ref.dir,   cluster.types = 'beads',   plot.select = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )  ##a flowstate containing spectral events class(ref) ref[['data']]  ##peak detectors ref$data[,.SD,.SDcols = is.factor] |> unique()  ##number of spectral events as defined using defaults ref$data[,.N,by = sample.id]  ##saved plot output list.files(tempdir()) |> grep(pattern = "select.*.pdf",value = TRUE)  ##detector.override ##for the sake of example ref <- reference.group.spectral.events(   raw.reference.group.directory = raw.ref.dir,   cluster.types = 'beads',   detector.override = c("Unstained (Beads)" = "UV7") ) ref$data[,.SD,.SDcols = is.factor] |> unique()  ##n.spectral.events.override ##for the sake of example ref <- reference.group.spectral.events(   raw.reference.group.directory = raw.ref.dir,   cluster.types = 'beads',   n.spectral.events.override = c("TNFa PE (Beads)" = 500) )  ##number of spectral events as defined using n.spectral.events.override ref$data[,.N,by = sample.id] } # }

what: Write a flowstate as a Flow Cytometry Standard file (FCS 3.1) — write.flowstate
title: Write a flowstate as a Flow Cytometry Standard file (FCS 3.1) — write.flowstate
text: flowstate – following Flow Cytometry Standard conventions – converted FCS 3.1 written disk. conversion follows: [['keywords']], [['parameters']], [['spill']] (present) converted character string using delimiter "|" separate keyword-value pairs. string forms TEXT segment FCS file. [['data']] written binary. forms DATA segment FCS file. HEADER segment (string) – containing required offsets – derived TEXT DATA. FCS 3.1 compliant file written disk. N.B.: testing, FCS 3.1 files written disk write.flowstate fully compatible read.flowstate flowCore::read.FCS; issues proprietary software (.e., FlowJo). proprietary software used FCS 3.1 files generated write.flowstate, caution advised.

title: Write a flowstate as a Flow Cytometry Standard file (FCS 3.1) — write.flowstate
code: write.flowstate(   flowstate.object,   new.fil = NULL,   add.fil.mod = TRUE,   file.dir,   endianness = c("little", "big") )

title: Write a flowstate as a Flow Cytometry Standard file (FCS 3.1) — write.flowstate
text: flowstate.object flowstate new.fil Character string – default NULL; defined, keyword '$FIL' updated provided value. add.fil.mod Logical – default TRUE; suffix 'flowstateMOD'(string) appended value '$FIL'. file.dir Character vector – base; file directory saving output FCS 3.1 file. endianness Character string – default "little"; see endian.
